result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Lee Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

****8-28-14 Judge Dallet, Court ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to state that counts one and three are concurrent with each other and 12CF4456 but consecutive to any other sentence. The judgment shall include a total of 43 days of sentence credit on counts one and three ****
Concurrent with: with each other and 12CF4456 but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 43 days served.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Lee Taylor in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Defendant Robert Lee Taylor in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 66 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with current sentence, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 48 days served.  Court ordered 30 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 36 MONTHS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Mental health evaluation and comply with all recommended treatment.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- No contact with firearms.

AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with Count 1 and current sentence, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 48 days time served. 

- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample if not already given, pay the surcharge, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.

Defendant Robert Lee Taylor in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Defendant Robert Lee Taylor in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNTS 2, 4, 5, 6 AND 7:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  The 7/14/14 jury trial is vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Kathleen A Lindgren in court, defendant Robert Lee Taylor not in court, in custody.  Molly Schmidt for Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-29-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Kathleen A Lindgren not in court.  Defendant Robert Lee Taylor not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel's staff contacted the court by telephone to inform that she is unable to appear in court on today's date and requests brief adjournment of today's scheduled scheduling conference.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 40.  State notified of next court date.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Robert Lee Taylor in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.  Defendant Robert Lee Taylor in custody.  Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Jonathon Newport.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Amended Complaint, which has probable cause for Counts 4 and 7, and Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SHEILA W., TW (10/10/2003) AND SJ (11/22/2004).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Lee Taylor in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Robert Lee Taylor in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.
AS TO COUNTS 4 & 7:  Motion to dismiss by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court; LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE.
AS TO COUNT 1, 2, 3, 5, AND 6:  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 2, 3, 5, AND 6.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
